greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime == 1 mod (4n).
comment: Note interesting patterns in the graph. - _Zak Seidov_, Dec 13 2011
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 5 is the smallest prime of the form 1+4m, 17 is the smallest prime of the form 1+8m, 13 is the smallest prime of the form 1+12m, etc. - _Zak Seidov_, Dec 13 2011
mathematica: nn=100; Reap[Do[p=1+4n; While[!PrimeQ[p], p=p+4n]; Sow[p], {n,nn}]][[2,1]] (* _Zak Seidov_, Dec 13 2011 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 15 2002
